subs.text: @roeiwrites Some related points: 1) There are no consequences for a certain type of pundit in being consistently wrong. Wertheimer is in good company with Gulf War promoters, Brett Stevens, and Bibi Netanyahu.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites Some related points: 1) There are no consequences for a certain type of pundit in being consistently wrong. Wertheimer is in good company with Gulf War promoters, Brett Stevens, and Bibi Netanyahu.

subs.text: @roeiwrites 2) Wertheimer was a top JTS official when it collapsed, along with Consetvative synagogue affiliation. This was in part because American Jews had dropped old models of Judaism (of which intermarriage is one symptom) but also because of structural and institutional failures.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites 2) Wertheimer was a top JTS official when it collapsed, along with Consetvative synagogue affiliation. This was in part because American Jews had dropped old models of Judaism (of which intermarriage is one symptom) but also because of structural and institutional failures.

subs.text: @roeiwrites To my knowledge, the only response Wertheimer offered was to lament that Jews no longer felt a sense of ‚Äúobligation.‚Äù
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites To my knowledge, the only response Wertheimer offered was to lament that Jews no longer felt a sense of ‚Äúobligation.‚Äù

subs.text: @roeiwrites At no time did he utilize scholarly models of religion or theology or sociology to figure out what was going on. He stuck with the pre-modern notion that if we just preach harder, people will change their ways.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites At no time did he utilize scholarly models of religion or theology or sociology to figure out what was going on. He stuck with the pre-modern notion that if we just preach harder, people will change their ways.

subs.text: @roeiwrites (The fact that that model didn‚Äôt work for Isaiah or Jeremiah or the Hatam Sofer seems to have escaped him.)
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites (The fact that that model didn‚Äôt work for Isaiah or Jeremiah or the Hatam Sofer seems to have escaped him.)

subs.text: @roeiwrites His insistence on seeing American Judaism through traditional categories was a profound epistemological mistake with real communal and institutional consequences.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites His insistence on seeing American Judaism through traditional categories was a profound epistemological mistake with real communal and institutional consequences.

subs.text: @roeiwrites 3) One ‚Äúexit interview‚Äù question I would like to ask the non and no-longer affiliated is whether the rise of religious extremism in Christian America, Jewish Israel, and the Muslim world had any impact on their view of religious worship.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites 3) One ‚Äúexit interview‚Äù question I would like to ask the non and no-longer affiliated is whether the rise of religious extremism in Christian America, Jewish Israel, and the Muslim world had any impact on their view of religious worship.

subs.text: @roeiwrites One result of the neoconservative movement‚Äôs successful effort to normalize Jews affiliating as Republican, even as the party more and more embraced an extremist religious agenda. I wonder about that effort‚Äôs impact on affiliation with Conservative Judaism, which unlike Reform
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites One result of the neoconservative movement‚Äôs successful effort to normalize Jews affiliating as Republican, even as the party more and more embraced an extremist religious agenda. I wonder about that effort‚Äôs impact on affiliation with Conservative Judaism, which unlike Reform

subs.text: @roeiwrites has not placed fighting white Christian extremism in all its aspects as a central or even nominal mandate.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites has not placed fighting white Christian extremism in all its aspects as a central or even nominal mandate.

subs.text: @roeiwrites 4) I doubt Wertheimer will be pleased by the announcement just now that JTS has named Rabbi Ayelet Cohen as its new rabbinical school dean, given her track record as a leader of the New Israel Fund and Congregation Bet Simchat Torah, NY‚Äôs pioneer gay shul.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites 4) I doubt Wertheimer will be pleased by the announcement just now that JTS has named Rabbi Ayelet Cohen as its new rabbinical school dean, given her track record as a leader of the New Israel Fund and Congregation Bet Simchat Torah, NY‚Äôs pioneer gay shul.

subs.text: @roeiwrites 5) Maintaining ‚ÄúJewish identity‚Äù in a voluntary society is a hard problem. Explaining why that might be a valuable goal is also a hard problem, but not one I believe Wertheimer ever undertook.
subs.rawText: @roeiwrites 5) Maintaining ‚ÄúJewish identity‚Äù in a voluntary society is a hard problem. Explaining why that might be a valuable goal is also a hard problem, but not one I believe Wertheimer ever undertook.

subs.text: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy It's not a fundraiser. It's a sales platform. Most successful Kickstarter campaign deliver concrete value for the money -- in this case, I assume it's books and signed souvenirs.
subs.rawText: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy It's not a fundraiser. It's a sales platform. Most successful Kickstarter campaign deliver concrete value for the money -- in this case, I assume it's books and signed souvenirs.

subs.text: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy One attraction of Kickstarter for those of us in publishing is the opportunity to take large sums from people who can write four-figure checks without thinking twice.
subs.rawText: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy One attraction of Kickstarter for those of us in publishing is the opportunity to take large sums from people who can write four-figure checks without thinking twice.

subs.text: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy I price my books mindful of people for whom $18 is an expense that requires thought and wouldn't spend $36 for a book. But with a Kickstarter, I can let people willing to pay $1000 to support my projects do so.
subs.rawText: @Stpolishook @prof_dainy I price my books mindful of people for whom $18 is an expense that requires thought and wouldn't spend $36 for a book. But with a Kickstarter, I can let people willing to pay $1000 to support my projects do so.
